# Recording King

; then revived in 2007
| related        =
| markets        = Worldwide
| previousowners = Montgomery Ward (1930s)
| trademarkregistrations = 12 April 2011 (latest), United States
| ambassadors    =
| tagline        =
| website        = [https://www.recordingking.com/ recordingking.com]
}}
Recording King is a  musical instruments brand currently owned by The Music Link Corporation, based in Hayward, California, which also produces other musical instrument lines.
Range of products commercialised under the Recording King brand are acoustic and resonator guitars, and banjos. Their guitars are designed in America, manufactured overseas and sold worldwide.Note: [http://www.acousticguitar.com/Gear/Steel-string-guitar/Recording-King-ROS-626 recent version of the page] has no review.
Brand history
Recording King started as a house brand for Montgomery Ward in the 1930s. Guitarist John Fahey played a 1939 model.
The original guitar was similar to the Gibson Advanced Jumbo, discontinued in 1939.
The brand was revived in 2007 by The Music Link in Hayward, CA.  Current Recording King products use vintage designs and replicas of pre-World War II parts.
Musicians
Musicians who use Recording King guitars include Justin Townes Earle.
